[30;1m67 | [0m[35m      Alternatively you can ditch ``setup_requires`` completely and[0m
[30;1m68 | [0m[35m      rely on other tools like `tox`_ or `make`_ to build your[0m
[30;1m69 | [0m[35m      project with the correct dependencies in place inside a virtual[0m
[30;1m70 | [0m[35m      environment. This have the advantage of increasing reproducibility.[0m
[30;1m71 | [0m[35m      With `tox`_ you can specify a ``build`` testenv with the `skip_install`_[0m
[30;1m72 | [0m[35m      option and the required build time dependencies listed in ``deps``.[0m
[30;1m73 | [0m[35m[0m

[30;1m334 | [0m[35m[0m

[30;1m336 | [0m[35m   Be careful though that some pip-based packages might not work perfectly within a conda environmen[0m
[30;1m337 | [0m[35m   but this concerns only certain packages that tamper with the environment itself like tox for inst[0m
[30;1m338 | [0m[35m   As a rule of thumb, always define a requirement as conda package if available and only resort to[0m

[30;1m325 | [0m[35m[0m

[30;1m328 | [0m[35m   the conda dependencies you can still add pip-installable packages by adding ``- pip`` as dependen[0m

[31m--[ [0m[34mMatch #[0m[33m24[0m[34m of [0m[33m759[0m[31m ]--[0m
   Rule Id: [34mBD000702[0m
       Tag: [34mSecurity.Backdoor.DataExfiltration.Environment[0m

   Pattern: [32m(env|environment).{1,50}(get|post|curl|nc|invoke-restmethod)[0m
[30;1m154 | [0m[35mprecise description of the dependency tree and enables re-creating the exact[0m
[30;1m155 | [0m[35msame environment elsewhere.[0m
[30;1m156 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m157 | [0m[35mPipenv supports two different sets of dependencies: the default one, and the[0m
[30;1m158 | [0m[35m`dev` set. The default set is meant to store runtime dependencies while the dev[0m
[30;1m159 | [0m[35mset is meant to store dependencies that are used only during development.[0m
[30;1m160 | [0m[35m[0m

[31m--[ [0m[34mMatch #[0m[33m25[0m[34m of [0m[33m759[0m[31m ]--[0m
   Rule Id: [34mBD000702[0m
       Tag: [34mSecurity.Backdoor.DataExfiltration.Environment[0m
  Severity: [36mImportant[0m, Confidence: [36mHigh[0m
  Filename: [33m/pyscaffold-4.6/docs/dependencies.rst[0m
   Pattern: [32m(env|environment).{1,50}(get|post|curl|nc|invoke-restmethod)[0m
[30;1m36 | [0m[35mBoth approaches have advantages and disadvantages, and usually are used[0m
[30;1m37 | [0m[35mtogether in different phases of a project. As a rule of thumb, libraries tend[0m
[30;1m38 | [0m[35mto emphasize abstract dependencies (but can still have concrete dependencies[0m
[30;1m39 | [0m[35mfor the development environment), while applications tend to rely on concrete[0m
[30;1m40 | [0m[35mdependencies (but can still have abstract dependencies specially if they are[0m
[30;1m41 | [0m[35mintended to be distributed via PyPI, e.g. command line tools and auxiliary WSGI[0m
[30;1m42 | [0m[35mapps/middleware to be mounted inside other domain-centric apps).[0m

[30;1m144 | [0m[35mVersioning and Git Integration[0m
[30;1m145 | [0m[35m==============================[0m
[30;1m146 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m147 | [0m[35mYour project is an already initialised Git repository and uses[0m
[30;1m148 | [0m[35mthe information of tags to infer the version of your project with the help of[0m
[30;1m149 | [0m[35msetuptools_scm_.[0m
[30;1m150 | [0m[35mTo use this feature, you need to tag with the format ``MAJOR.MINOR[.PATCH]``[0m

[30;1m140 | [0m[35mchecks). Additionally you can exclude them explicitly via the[0m

[30;1m396 | [0m[35m    rename it to a proper semantic version like ``v0.4.2``.[0m
[30;1m397 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m398 | [0m[35m    Please also note that ``setuptools-scm`` may also fail if a single commit[0m
[30;1m399 | [0m[35m    has multiple tags and at least one of them is problematic (``setuptools-scm``[0m
[30;1m400 | [0m[35m    *will not* try multiple tags until it finds the correct one).[0m
[30;1m401 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m402 | [0m[35m.. _sdist-questions:[0m

[31m--[ [0m[34mMatch #[0m[33m327[0m[34m of [0m[33m759[0m[31m ]--[0m
   Rule Id: [34mBD000600[0m
       Tag: [34mSecurity.Backdoor.LOLBAS.Windows[0m
  Severity: [36mModerate[0m, Confidence: [36mLow[0m
  Filename: [33m/pyscaffold-4.6/docs/faq.rst[0m
   Pattern: [32m\s(advpack\.dll|appvlp|at|atbroker|bash|bginfo|bitsadmin|cdb|certutil|cl_invocation\.ps1|cl_mutexverifiers\.ps1|cmd|cmdkey|cmstp|comsvcs\.dll|control|csc|cscript|csi|devtoolslauncher|dfsvc|diskshadow|dnscmd|dnx|dotnet|dxcap|esentutl|eventvwr|excel|expand|extexport|extrac32|findstr|forfiles|ftp|gfxdownloadwrapper|gpscript|hh|ie4uinit|ieadvpack\.dll|ieaframe\.dll|ic|infdefaultinstall|installutil|jsc|makecab|manage-bde\.wsf|mavinject|mftrace|microsoft\.workflow\.compiler|mmc|msbuild|msconfig|msdeploy|msdt|mshta|mshtml\.dll|msc|msxsl|netsh|odbcconf|pcalua|pcwrun|pcwutl\.dll|pester\.bat|powerpnt|presentationhost|pubprn\.vbs|rcsi|reg|regasm|regedit|register-cimprovider|regsvcs|regsvr32|rpcping|rundll32|runonce|runscripthelper|sc|schtasks|scriptrunner|setupapi\.dll|shdocvw\.dll|shell32\.dll|slmgr\.vbs|sqldumper|sqlps|sqltoolsps|squirrel|syncappvpublishingserver|syncappvpublishingserver\.vbs|syssetup\.dll|te|tracker|tttracer|update|url\.dll|verclsid|vsjitdebugger|wab|winrm\.vbs|winword|wmic|wscript|wsl|wsreset|xwizard|zipfldr\.dll)\s[0m
[30;1m250 | [0m[35m    `pkg_resources`_ namespaces in favour of :pep:`420`. Unfortunately these two[0m
[30;1m251 | [0m[35m    methodologies for creating namespaces are not compatible, as documented in[0m
[30;1m252 | [0m[35m    the `packaging namespace packages official guide`_. To fix this problem you[0m
[30;1m253 | [0m[35m    (or other maintainers) will need to either **(a)** update all the existing[0m
[30;1m254 | [0m[35m    "subpackages" in the same namespace to be implicit (:pep:`420`-style), or[0m
[30;1m255 | [0m[35m    **(b)** get rid of the implicit namespace configuration PyScaffold[0m
[30;1m256 | [0m[35m    automatically sets up during project creation/update. Please check the[0m

[31m--[ [0m[34mMatch #[0m[33m328[0m[34m of [0m[33m759[0m[31m ]--[0m
   Rule Id: [34mBD000600[0m
       Tag: [34mSecurity.Backdoor.LOLBAS.Windows[0m
  Severity: [36mModerate[0m, Confidence: [36mLow[0m
  Filename: [33m/pyscaffold-4.6/docs/faq.rst[0m
   Pattern: [32m\s(advpack\.dll|appvlp|at|atbroker|bash|bginfo|bitsadmin|cdb|certutil|cl_invocation\.ps1|cl_mutexverifiers\.ps1|cmd|cmdkey|cmstp|comsvcs\.dll|control|csc|cscript|csi|devtoolslauncher|dfsvc|diskshadow|dnscmd|dnx|dotnet|dxcap|esentutl|eventvwr|excel|expand|extexport|extrac32|findstr|forfiles|ftp|gfxdownloadwrapper|gpscript|hh|ie4uinit|ieadvpack\.dll|ieaframe\.dll|ic|infdefaultinstall|installutil|jsc|makecab|manage-bde\.wsf|mavinject|mftrace|microsoft\.workflow\.compiler|mmc|msbuild|msconfig|msdeploy|msdt|mshta|mshtml\.dll|msc|msxsl|netsh|odbcconf|pcalua|pcwrun|pcwutl\.dll|pester\.bat|powerpnt|presentationhost|pubprn\.vbs|rcsi|reg|regasm|regedit|register-cimprovider|regsvcs|regsvr32|rpcping|rundll32|runonce|runscripthelper|sc|schtasks|scriptrunner|setupapi\.dll|shdocvw\.dll|shell32\.dll|slmgr\.vbs|sqldumper|sqlps|sqltoolsps|squirrel|syncappvpublishingserver|syncappvpublishingserver\.vbs|syssetup\.dll|te|tracker|tttracer|update|url\.dll|verclsid|vsjitdebugger|wab|winrm\.vbs|winword|wmic|wscript|wsl|wsreset|xwizard|zipfldr\.dll)\s[0m
[30;1m198 | [0m[35mred to the case when the actual Python package resides in the same folder as[0m
[30;1m199 | [0m[35m   your configuration and test files.[0m
[30;1m200 | [0m[35m   A nice `blog post by Ionel`_ gives a thorough explanation why this is so. In a nutshell, the most[0m
[30;1m201 | [0m[35m   problem comes from the fact that Python imports a package by first looking at the current working[0m
[30;1m202 | [0m[35m   into the ``PYTHONPATH`` environment variable. If your current working directory is the root of yo[0m
[30;1m203 | [0m[35m   you are thus not testing the installation of your package but the local package directly. Eventua[0m

[30;1m183 | [0m[35m.. _git-default-branch:[0m
[30;1m184 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m185 | [0m[35mHow can I change Git's default branch when creating a new project setup with PyScaffold?[0m
[30;1m186 | [0m[35m    The default branch in Git used to be ``master`` (and still is at least until version 2.32) but n[0m
[30;1m187 | [0m[35m    preferred name. When you use PyScaffold's ``putup`` to set up your project and want to explicitl[0m
[30;1m188 | [0m[35m    name, just configure this using ``git config``, e.g.::[0m
[30;1m189 | [0m[35m[0m

[30;1m162 | [0m[35mWhat is the license of the generated project scaffold? Is there anything I need to consider?[0m
[30;1m163 | [0m[35m    The source code of PyScaffold itself is MIT-licensed with the exception of the `*.template` file[0m
[30;1m164 | [0m[35m    which are licensed under the BSD 0-Clause license (0BSD). Thus, also the generated boilerplate c[0m
[30;1m165 | [0m[35m    is 0BSD-licensed and consequently you have no obligations at all and can do whatever you want ex[0m

[30;1m119 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m120 | [0m[35m    PyScaffold uses the logging infrastructure from Python standard library, and[0m
[30;1m121 | [0m[35m    emits notifications during its execution. Therefore, it is possible to control[0m
[30;1m122 | [0m[35m    which messages are logged by properly setting the log level (internally, most[0m
[30;1m123 | [0m[35m    of the messages are produced under the ``INFO`` level).  By default, a[0m
[30;1m124 | [0m[35m    :class:`~logging.StreamHandler` is attached to the logger, however it is[0m
[30;1m125 | [0m[35m    possible to replace it with a custom handler using[0m

[30;1m392 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m393 | [0m[35mWhy do I see the error ``AssertionError: Can't parse version ...``?[0m
[30;1m394 | [0m[35m    The way ``setuptools-scm`` parses git tags has some edge cases leading[0m
[30;1m395 | [0m[35m    to this assertion error. The best way is to either remove the tag or[0m
[30;1m396 | [0m[35m    rename it to a proper semantic version like ``v0.4.2``.[0m
[30;1m397 | [0m[35m[0m

[30;1m378 | [0m[35mHow can I configure and debug the exact version exported by my package?[0m
[30;1m379 | [0m[35m    PyScaffold will include a default configuration for your project[0m
[30;1m380 | [0m[35m    that uses the name of the latest git tag and the status of your working[0m
[30;1m381 | [0m[35m    tree to create a suitable version string.[0m
[30;1m382 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m383 | [0m[35m    You can tweak this configuration to change how this string is produced. The[0m

[31m--[ [0m[34mMatch #[0m[33m335[0m[34m of [0m[33m759[0m[31m ]--[0m
   Rule Id: [34mBD000610[0m

[30;1m369 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m370 | [0m[35m    This means that ``setuptools-scm`` could not find an intact git repository. If you still want to[0m

[30;1m372 | [0m[35m    you can try setting :pypi:`setuptools-scm` environment variables, e.g. ``SETUPTOOLS_SCM_PRETEND_[0m
[30;1m373 | [0m[35m    If that is not enough, try completely removing it. In ``setup.cfg`` in the section ``[metadata]`[0m

[30;1m364 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m365 | [0m[35mHow can I build a distribution if I have only the source code without a proper git repo?[0m
[30;1m366 | [0m[35m    If you see an error message like::[0m
[30;1m367 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m368 | [0m[35m       setuptools-scm was unable to detect version for 'your/project'.[0m

[30;1m359 | [0m[35m        git describe --dirty --tags --long --first-parent[0m
[30;1m360 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m361 | [0m[35m    which is basically what :pypi:`setuptools-scm` does to retrieve the correct version number. If t[0m
[30;1m362 | [0m[35m    fails, tweak how your repo is cloned depending on your CI service and make sure to also download[0m
[30;1m363 | [0m[35m    i.e. ``git fetch origin --tags``.[0m
[30;1m364 | [0m[35m[0m

[30;1m195 | [0m[35m-----------------------------------------[0m
[30;1m196 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m197 | [0m[35mWhy does PyScaffold ≥ 3 have a ``src`` folder which holds the actual Python package?[0m
[30;1m198 | [0m[35m   This avoids quite many problems compared to the case when the actual Python package resides in th[0m
[30;1m199 | [0m[35m   your configuration and test files.[0m
[30;1m200 | [0m[35m   A nice `blog post by Ionel`_ gives a thorough explanation why this is so. In a nutshell, the most[0m
[30;1m201 | [0m[35m   problem comes from the fact that Python imports a package by first looking at the current working[0m

[30;1m22 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m23 | [0m[35mSince the overall structure of a project set up with PyScaffold 2 differs quite[0m
[30;1m24 | [0m[35mmuch from a project generated with PyScaffold 3 it is not possible to just use[0m
[30;1m25 | [0m[35mthe ``--update`` parameter. Still with some manual efforts an update from[0m
[30;1m26 | [0m[35ma scaffold generated with PyScaffold 2 to PyScaffold 3's scaffold is quite easy.[0m
[30;1m27 | [0m[35mAssume the name of our project is ``old_project`` with a package called[0m
[30;1m28 | [0m[35m``old_package`` and no namespaces then just:[0m

[30;1m7 | [0m[35mWhen updating a project generated with the same major version of PyScaffold[0m
[30;1m8 | [0m[35m[#up1]_, running ``putup --update`` should be enough to get you going.[0m
[30;1m9 | [0m[35mHowever updating from previous major versions of PyScaffold will probably[0m
[30;1m10 | [0m[35mrequire some manual adjustments. The following sections describe how to update[0m
[30;1m11 | [0m[35mfrom one major version into the following one.[0m
[30;1m12 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m13 | [0m[35m.. tip::[0m
[30;1m14 | [0m[35m   Before updating make sure to commit all the pending changes in your[0m

[30;1m69 | [0m[35m      project with the correct dependencies in place inside a virtual[0m

[30;1m43 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m44 | [0m[35m**Most of the time, updating from PyScaffold 3 should be completely automatic**.[0m
[30;1m45 | [0m[35mHowever, since in version 4 we have adopted Python's new standards for[0m
[30;1m46 | [0m[35mpackaging (:pep:`517`/:pep:`518`), you might find the new build process incompatible.[0m
[30;1m47 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m48 | [0m[35m.. _no-pyproject-steps:[0m
[30;1m49 | [0m[35m[0m

[31m--[ [0m[34mMatch #[0m[33m389[0m[34m of [0m[33m759[0m[31m ]--[0m

[30;1m30 | [0m[35m1) make sure your worktree is not dirty, i.e. commit all your changes,[0m
[30;1m31 | [0m[35m2) run ``putup old_project --force --no-skeleton -p old_package`` to generate[0m
[30;1m32 | [0m[35m   the new structure inplace and ``cd`` into your project,[0m
[30;1m33 | [0m[35m3) move with ``git mv old_package/* src/old_package/ --force`` your old package[0m
[30;1m34 | [0m[35m   over to the new ``src`` directory,[0m
[30;1m35 | [0m[35m4) check ``git status`` and add untracked files from the new structure,[0m
[30;1m36 | [0m[35m5) use ``git difftool`` to check all overwritten files, especially ``setup.cfg``,[0m

[30;1m76 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m77 | [0m[35mPyScaffold's documentation is written in `reStructuredText`_ and uses `Sphinx`_[0m
[30;1m78 | [0m[35mas its main documentation compiler [#contrib1]_. This means that the docs are[0m
[30;1m79 | [0m[35mkept in the same repository as the project code, and that any documentation[0m
[30;1m80 | [0m[35mupdate is done via GitHub pull requests, as if it was a code contribution.[0m
[30;1m81 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m82 | [0m[35mWhile that might be scary for new programmers, it is actually a very nice way[0m
[30;1m83 | [0m[35mof getting started in the open source community, since doc contributions are[0m

[30;1m447 | [0m[35mPlease also notice that independently of the strategy you and the reviewers[0m
[30;1m448 | [0m[35magree on, it might be worthy to ask them to just review the PRs without merging[0m
[30;1m449 | [0m[35m(so you are responsible for closing the PRs and bringing their code to the[0m
[30;1m450 | [0m[35mlong-lived branch via git ``merge``, ``pull`` or ``cherry-pick``).[0m
[30;1m451 | [0m[35mThis might avoid confusion since GitHub does not provide any special mechanism[0m
[30;1m452 | [0m[35mfor dealing with dependencies between PRs. Moreover, the merging might be just[0m
[30;1m453 | [0m[35measier via git_ CLI.[0m

[30;1m369 | [0m[35m~~~~~~~~[0m
[30;1m370 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m371 | [0m[35mNew PyScaffold releases should be automatically uploaded to PyPI by one of our[0m
[30;1m372 | [0m[35m`GitHub actions`_ every time a new tag is pushed to the repository.[0m
[30;1m373 | [0m[35mTherefore, as a PyScaffold maintainer, the following steps are all you need[0m
[30;1m374 | [0m[35mto release a new version:[0m
[30;1m375 | [0m[35m[0m

[30;1m342 | [0m[35m|:mag:| Code Reviews and Issue Triage[0m
[30;1m343 | [0m[35m-------------------------------------[0m
[30;1m344 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m345 | [0m[35mIf you are an experienced developer and wants to help, but do not have the time[0m
[30;1m346 | [0m[35mto create complete pull requests, you can still help by `reviewing existing open[0m
[30;1m347 | [0m[35mpull requests`_, or going through the open issues and evaluating them according to our[0m
[30;1m348 | [0m[35mlabels_ and even suggesting possible solutions or workarounds.[0m
[30;1m349 | [0m[35m[0m

[31m--[ [0m[34mMatch #[0m[33m400[0m[34m of [0m[33m759[0m[31m ]--[0m

       Tag: [34mSecurity.Backdoor.LOLBAS.Linux[0m
  Severity: [36mModerate[0m, Confidence: [36mLow[0m

[30;1m313 | [0m[35m    is not being installed.[0m
[30;1m314 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m315 | [0m[35mSometimes |tox|_ misses out when new dependencies are added, especially to[0m
[30;1m316 | [0m[35m``setup.cfg`` and ``docs/requirements.txt``. If you find any problems with[0m
[30;1m317 | [0m[35mmissing dependencies when running a command with |tox|_, try to recreate the[0m
[30;1m318 | [0m[35m``tox`` environment using the ``-r`` flag. For example, instead of::[0m
[30;1m319 | [0m[35m[0m

[31m--[ [0m[34mMatch #[0m[33m401[0m[34m of [0m[33m759[0m[31m ]--[0m

[30;1m311 | [0m[35mFor instance conda_ allows you to create isolated environments by specifying also the[0m
[30;1m312 | [0m[35mPython version and even system libraries like ``glibc``. In the pip_ ecosystem, one[0m
[30;1m313 | [0m[35mneeds a tool like pyenv_ to choose the Python version and the installation of[0m

[30;1m310 | [0m[35mseveral different tools and has a deeper isolation than the pip package manager.[0m
[30;1m311 | [0m[35mFor instance conda_ allows you to create isolated environments by specifying also the[0m

[30;1m259 | [0m[35m    # ... edit setup.cfg to add dependencies ...[0m

[31m--[ [0m[34mMatch #[0m[33m451[0m[34m of [0m[33m759[0m[31m ]--[0m

[30;1m227 | [0m[35m   file paths in the compiled file, which will make it impossible to share).[0m
[30;1m228 | [0m[35m   However this situation might change in the near future.[0m

[30;1m231 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m232 | [0m[35m   When using ``-e file:.`` in your ``requirements.in`` file,[0m

[31m--[ [0m[34mMatch #[0m[33m452[0m[34m of [0m[33m759[0m[31m ]--[0m
   Rule Id: [34mBD000610[0m
       Tag: [34mSecurity.Backdoor.LOLBAS.Linux[0m
  Severity: [36mModerate[0m, Confidence: [36mLow[0m
  Filename: [33m/pyscaffold-4.6/docs/dependencies.rst[0m
   Pattern: [32m\s(apt|apt\-get|aria2c|arp|ash|awk|base64|bash|bpftrace|busybox|cat|chmod|chown|cp|cpan|cpulimit|crontab|csh|curl|cut|dash|dd|diff|dmesg|dmsetup|dnf|docker|dpkg|easy_install|ed|emacs|env|expand|expect|facter|find|finger|flock|fmt|ftp|gawk|gdb|gimp|git|grep|head|iftop|ionice|ip|irb|jjs|journalctl|jrunscript|ksh|ld\.so|ldconfig|logsave|ltrace|lua|mail|mawk|mount|mtr|mv|mysql|nano|nawk|nc|nice|nl|nmap|node|od|openssl|perl|pg|php|pic|pico|pip|puppet|readelf|red|rlogin|rlwrap|rpm|rpmquery|rsync|ruby|run\-mailcap|run\-parts|rvim|scp|screen|script|sed|service|setarch|sftp|shuf|smbclient|socat|sort|sqlite3|ssh|start\-stop\-daemon|stdbuf|strace|systemctl|tail|tar|taskset|tclsh|tcpdump|tee|telnet|tftp|time|timeout|tmux|top|ul|unexpand|uniq|unshare|vi|vim|watch|wget|whois|wish|xargs|xxd|yum|zsh|zypper)\s[0m
[30;1m222 | [0m[35m``setup.cfg``' ``install_requires`` is to add *something like* ``-e .`` to it.[0m
[30;1m223 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m224 | [0m[35m.. warning::[0m
[30;1m225 | [0m[35m   For the time being adding ``-e file:.`` is a working[0m
[30;1m226 | [0m[35m   solution that is tested by |pip-tools|_ team (``-e .`` will generate absolute[0m
[30;1m227 | [0m[35m   file paths in the compiled file, which will make it impossible to share).[0m
[30;1m228 | [0m[35m   However this situation might change in the near future.[0m

[31m--[ [0m[34mMatch #[0m[33m453[0m[34m of [0m[33m759[0m[31m ]--[0m
   Rule Id: [34mBD000610[0m
       Tag: [34mSecurity.Backdoor.LOLBAS.Linux[0m
  Severity: [36mModerate[0m, Confidence: [36mLow[0m
  Filename: [33m/pyscaffold-4.6/docs/dependencies.rst[0m
   Pattern: [32m\s(apt|apt\-get|aria2c|arp|ash|awk|base64|bash|bpftrace|busybox|cat|chmod|chown|cp|cpan|cpulimit|crontab|csh|curl|cut|dash|dd|diff|dmesg|dmsetup|dnf|docker|dpkg|easy_install|ed|emacs|env|expand|expect|facter|find|finger|flock|fmt|ftp|gawk|gdb|gimp|git|grep|head|iftop|ionice|ip|irb|jjs|journalctl|jrunscript|ksh|ld\.so|ldconfig|logsave|ltrace|lua|mail|mawk|mount|mtr|mv|mysql|nano|nawk|nc|nice|nl|nmap|node|od|openssl|perl|pg|php|pic|pico|pip|puppet|readelf|red|rlogin|rlwrap|rpm|rpmquery|rsync|ruby|run\-mailcap|run\-parts|rvim|scp|screen|script|sed|service|setarch|sftp|shuf|smbclient|socat|sort|sqlite3|ssh|start\-stop\-daemon|stdbuf|strace|systemctl|tail|tar|taskset|tclsh|tcpdump|tee|telnet|tftp|time|timeout|tmux|top|ul|unexpand|uniq|unshare|vi|vim|watch|wget|whois|wish|xargs|xxd|yum|zsh|zypper)\s[0m
[30;1m203 | [0m[35m    pip-tools is generating absolute file paths inside ``requirements.txt``[0m
[30;1m204 | [0m[35m    for ``-e .``, which prevents adding concrete dependencies to the repository[0m
[30;1m205 | [0m[35m    and therefore misses the whole point of using such tool.[0m
[30;1m206 | [0m[35m    For the time being, ``-e file:.`` seems to be a good workaround.[0m
[30;1m207 | [0m[35m    We need to monitor the issue and them update accordingly[0m
[30;1m208 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m209 | [0m[35mIntegration with pip-tools[0m

[30;1m171 | [0m[35mwith the non-automated workflow) in the default set, and all the other ones in[0m

[30;1m173 | [0m[35m``Pipfile.lock`` to your git repository to achieve reproducibility (maintaining[0m
[30;1m174 | [0m[35ma single ``Pipfile.lock`` shared by all the developers in the same project can[0m

   Pattern: [32m\s(advpack\.dll|appvlp|at|atbroker|bash|bginfo|bitsadmin|cdb|certutil|cl_invocation\.ps1|cl_mutexverifiers\.ps1|cmd|cmdkey|cmstp|comsvcs\.dll|control|csc|cscript|csi|devtoolslauncher|dfsvc|diskshadow|dnscmd|dnx|dotnet|dxcap|esentutl|eventvwr|excel|expand|extexport|extrac32|findstr|forfiles|ftp|gfxdownloadwrapper|gpscript|hh|ie4uinit|ieadvpack\.dll|ieaframe\.dll|ic|infdefaultinstall|installutil|jsc|makecab|manage-bde\.wsf|mavinject|mftrace|microsoft\.workflow\.compiler|mmc|msbuild|msconfig|msdeploy|msdt|mshta|mshtml\.dll|msc|msxsl|netsh|odbcconf|pcalua|pcwrun|pcwutl\.dll|pester\.bat|powerpnt|presentationhost|pubprn\.vbs|rcsi|reg|regasm|regedit|register-cimprovider|regsvcs|regsvr32|rpcping|rundll32|runonce|runscripthelper|sc|schtasks|scriptrunner|setupapi\.dll|shdocvw\.dll|shell32\.dll|slmgr\.vbs|sqldumper|sqlps|sqltoolsps|squirrel|syncappvpublishingserver|syncappvpublishingserver\.vbs|syssetup\.dll|te|tracker|tttracer|update|url\.dll|verclsid|vsjitdebugger|wab|winrm\.vbs|winword|wmic|wscript|wsl|wsreset|xwizard|zipfldr\.dll)\s[0m
[30;1m263 | [0m[35m:obj:`~pyscaffold.operations.no_overwrite` avoids an existing file to be[0m
[30;1m264 | [0m[35moverwritten when ``putup`` is used in update mode.[0m
[30;1m265 | [0m[35mSimilarly, :obj:`~pyscaffold.operations.skip_on_update` avoids creating a[0m
[30;1m266 | [0m[35mfile from template in update mode, even if it does not exist.[0m
[30;1m267 | [0m[35mOn the other hand, :obj:`~pyscaffold.operations.add_permissions` will change[0m
[30;1m268 | [0m[35mthe file access permissions if it is created or already exists in the disk.[0m
[30;1m269 | [0m[35m[0m

[30;1m7 | [0m[35mPyScaffold is carefully designed to cover the essentials of authoring and[0m
[30;1m8 | [0m[35mdistributing Python packages. Most of time, tweaking ``putup`` options is[0m
[30;1m9 | [0m[35menough to ensure proper configuration of a project.[0m
[30;1m10 | [0m[35mHowever, for advanced use cases PyScaffold can be extended at runtime by other[0m
[30;1m11 | [0m[35mPython packages, providing a deeper level of programmability and customization.[0m
[30;1m12 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m13 | [0m[35mFrom the standpoint of PyScaffold, an extension is just an class inheriting[0m

[31m--[ [0m[34mMatch #[0m[33m529[0m[34m of [0m[33m759[0m[31m ]--[0m

[30;1m442 | [0m[35mit is close enough and shorter.[0m
[30;1m443 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m444 | [0m[35mSimilarly to ``sphinxcontrib-*`` packages, names registered in PyPI should[0m
[30;1m445 | [0m[35mcontain a dash ``-``, instead of a dot ``.``. This way, third-party extension[0m
[30;1m446 | [0m[35mdevelopment can be easily bootstrapped with the command::[0m
[30;1m447 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m448 | [0m[35m    putup pyscaffoldext-${EXT_NAME} -p ${EXT_NAME} --namespace pyscaffoldext --no-skeleton[0m

[30;1m435 | [0m[35mConventions for Community Extensions[0m
[30;1m436 | [0m[35m====================================[0m
[30;1m437 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m438 | [0m[35mIn order to make it easy to find PyScaffold extensions, community packages[0m
[30;1m439 | [0m[35mshould be namespaced as in ``pyscaffoldext.${EXT_NAME}`` (where ``${EXT_NAME}``[0m
[30;1m440 | [0m[35mis the name of the extension being developed). Although this naming convention[0m
[30;1m441 | [0m[35mslightly differs from :pep:`423 <423#use-standard-pattern-for-community-contributions>`,[0m

[30;1m346 | [0m[35mExtra Configurations[0m
[30;1m347 | [0m[35m--------------------[0m
[30;1m348 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m349 | [0m[35mSimilarly to ``persist = False``, existing extensions might accept some sort[0m
[30;1m350 | [0m[35mof metadata to be defined by new extensions.[0m
[30;1m351 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m352 | [0m[35mThis is the case of the :mod:`pyscaffold.extensions.interactive`, that allows[0m
[30;1m353 | [0m[35musers to interactively choose PyScaffold's parameters by editing a file[0m

[31m--[ [0m[34mMatch #[0m[33m532[0m[34m of [0m[33m759[0m[31m ]--[0m
   Rule Id: [34mBD000610[0m
       Tag: [34mSecurity.Backdoor.LOLBAS.Linux[0m
  Severity: [36mModerate[0m, Confidence: [36mLow[0m
  Filename: [33m/pyscaffold-4.6/docs/extensions.rst[0m
   Pattern: [32m\s(apt|apt\-get|aria2c|arp|ash|awk|base64|bash|bpftrace|busybox|cat|chmod|chown|cp|cpan|cpulimit|crontab|csh|curl|cut|dash|dd|diff|dmesg|dmsetup|dnf|docker|dpkg|easy_install|ed|emacs|env|expand|expect|facter|find|finger|flock|fmt|ftp|gawk|gdb|gimp|git|grep|head|iftop|ionice|ip|irb|jjs|journalctl|jrunscript|ksh|ld\.so|ldconfig|logsave|ltrace|lua|mail|mawk|mount|mtr|mv|mysql|nano|nawk|nc|nice|nl|nmap|node|od|openssl|perl|pg|php|pic|pico|pip|puppet|readelf|red|rlogin|rlwrap|rpm|rpmquery|rsync|ruby|run\-mailcap|run\-parts|rvim|scp|screen|script|sed|service|setarch|sftp|shuf|smbclient|socat|sort|sqlite3|ssh|start\-stop\-daemon|stdbuf|strace|systemctl|tail|tar|taskset|tclsh|tcpdump|tee|telnet|tftp|time|timeout|tmux|top|ul|unexpand|uniq|unshare|vi|vim|watch|wget|whois|wish|xargs|xxd|yum|zsh|zypper)\s[0m
[30;1m325 | [0m[35m----------------------------------------[0m
[30;1m326 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m327 | [0m[35mPyScaffold will save the name of your extension in a **pyscaffold** section[0m
[30;1m328 | [0m[35minside the ``setup.cfg`` files and automatically activate it again every time[0m
[30;1m329 | [0m[35mthe user runs ``putup --update``. To prevent it from happening you can[0m
[30;1m330 | [0m[35mset ``persist = False`` in your extension instances or class.[0m
[30;1m331 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m332 | [0m[35mPyScaffold can also save extension-specific options if the names of those[0m

[31m--[ [0m[34mMatch #[0m[33m533[0m[34m of [0m[33m759[0m[31m ]--[0m

[30;1m294 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m295 | [0m[35m.. tip::[0m
[30;1m296 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m297 | [0m[35m    In order to guarantee consistency and allow PyScaffold to unequivocally find[0m
[30;1m298 | [0m[35m    your extension, the name of the entry point should be a "underscore" version[0m
[30;1m299 | [0m[35m    of the name of the extension class (e.g. an entry point ``awesome_files``[0m
[30;1m300 | [0m[35m    for the ``AwesomeFiles`` class). If you really need to customize that[0m
[30;1m301 | [0m[35m    behaviour, please overwrite the ``name`` property of your class to match[0m

[31m--[ [0m[34mMatch #[0m[33m534[0m[34m of [0m[33m759[0m[31m ]--[0m
   Rule Id: [34mBD000610[0m
       Tag: [34mSecurity.Backdoor.LOLBAS.Linux[0m
  Severity: [36mModerate[0m, Confidence: [36mLow[0m

[30;1m101 | [0m[35m    actions.register(action_sequence, hook2, after="pyscaffold.structure:create_structure")[0m
[30;1m102 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m103 | [0m[35mThe first form uses as a position reference the first action with a matching[0m
[30;1m104 | [0m[35mname, regardless of the module. Accordingly, the second form tries to find an[0m
[30;1m105 | [0m[35maction that matches both the given name and module. When no reference is given,[0m
[30;1m106 | [0m[35m:obj:`~pyscaffold.actions.register` assumes as default position[0m
[30;1m107 | [0m[35m``after="pyscaffold.structure:define_structure"``.  This position is special[0m

[30;1m31 | [0m[35mdef uniqstr():[0m
[30;1m32 | [0m[35m    """Generates a unique random long string every time it is called"""[0m
[30;1m33 | [0m[35m    return str(uuid4())[0m
[30;1m34 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m35 | [0m[35m[0m

[30;1m189 | [0m[35mPyScaffold also allows you to save your favourite configuration to a file that[0m
[30;1m190 | [0m[35mwill be automatically read every time you run ``putup``, this way you can avoid[0m
[30;1m191 | [0m[35malways retyping the same command line options.[0m

[30;1m107 | [0m[35m  It will open your default text editor with a file containing examples and[0m

[30;1m109 | [0m[35m  text, once the file is saved and closed all the values you leave there are[0m

[30;1m54 | [0m[35mExtensions[0m
[30;1m55 | [0m[35m==========[0m
[30;1m56 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m57 | [0m[35mExtensions are a mechanism provided by PyScaffold to modify its action pipeline[0m
[30;1m58 | [0m[35mat runtime and the preferred way of adding new functionality.[0m
[30;1m59 | [0m[35mThere are **built-in extensions** (e.g. :mod:`pyscaffold.extensions.cirrus`)[0m
[30;1m60 | [0m[35mand **external extensions** (e.g. `pyscaffoldext-dsproject`_), but both types[0m
[30;1m61 | [0m[35mof extensions work exactly in the same way.[0m

[30;1m122 | [0m[35m.. tip::[0m
[30;1m123 | [0m[35m   Using package files to store runtime configuration or mutable data is not[0m
[30;1m124 | [0m[35m   considered good practice. Package files should be read-only. If you need[0m
[30;1m125 | [0m[35m   configuration files, or files that should be written at runtime, please[0m
[30;1m126 | [0m[35m   consider doing so inside standard locations in the user's home folder[0m
[30;1m127 | [0m[35m   (:pypi:`platformdirs` is a good library for that).[0m
[30;1m128 | [0m[35m   If needed you can even create them at the first usage from a read-only[0m

[30;1m76 | [0m[35m   explicitly with `pkg_resources`_, instead of :pep:`420`. Moreover, if you[0m
[30;1m77 | [0m[35m   are developing "subpackages" for already existing namespaces, please check[0m
[30;1m78 | [0m[35m   which convention the namespaces are currently following. Different styles of[0m
[30;1m79 | [0m[35m   `namespace packages`_ might be incompatible. If you don't want to update[0m
[30;1m80 | [0m[35m   existing namespace packages to :pep:`420`, you will probably need to[0m
[30;1m81 | [0m[35m   manually copy the ``__init__.py`` file for the umbrella namespace folder[0m
[30;1m82 | [0m[35m   from an existing project. Additionally have a look in our :ref:`FAQ <faq>`[0m
[30;1m83 | [0m[35m   about how to disable implicit namespaces.[0m

[30;1m111 | [0m[35mguaranteed to be read when creating a `wheels`_ distribution. Other distribution methods might[0m
[30;1m112 | [0m[35mbehave unexpectedly (e.g. always including data files even when[0m
[30;1m113 | [0m[35m``include_package_data = False``). Therefore, the best option if you want to have[0m

[30;1m117 | [0m[35mchecks). Additionally you can exclude them explicitly via the[0m

[30;1m52 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m53 | [0m[35mPlease notice that PyPI_ does not allow uploading local versions, e.g. ``0.0.dev5+gc5da6ad``,[0m
[30;1m54 | [0m[35mfor practical reasons. Thus, you have to create a Git tag before uploading a version[0m
[30;1m55 | [0m[35mof your distribution. Read more about it in the versioning_ section below.[0m
[30;1m56 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m57 | [0m[35m.. warning::[0m

  Filename: [33m/pyscaffold-4.6/tests/conftest.py[0m
   Pattern: [32m\s(apt|apt\-get|aria2c|arp|ash|awk|base64|bash|bpftrace|busybox|cat|chmod|chown|cp|cpan|cpulimit|crontab|csh|curl|cut|dash|dd|diff|dmesg|dmsetup|dnf|docker|dpkg|easy_install|ed|emacs|env|expand|expect|facter|find|finger|flock|fmt|ftp|gawk|gdb|gimp|git|grep|head|iftop|ionice|ip|irb|jjs|journalctl|jrunscript|ksh|ld\.so|ldconfig|logsave|ltrace|lua|mail|mawk|mount|mtr|mv|mysql|nano|nawk|nc|nice|nl|nmap|node|od|openssl|perl|pg|php|pic|pico|pip|puppet|readelf|red|rlogin|rlwrap|rpm|rpmquery|rsync|ruby|run\-mailcap|run\-parts|rvim|scp|screen|script|sed|service|setarch|sftp|shuf|smbclient|socat|sort|sqlite3|ssh|start\-stop\-daemon|stdbuf|strace|systemctl|tail|tar|taskset|tclsh|tcpdump|tee|telnet|tftp|time|timeout|tmux|top|ul|unexpand|uniq|unshare|vi|vim|watch|wget|whois|wish|xargs|xxd|yum|zsh|zypper)\s[0m
[30;1m162 | [0m[35m    # In Python the common idiom of using logging is to share the same log[0m
[30;1m163 | [0m[35m    # globally, even between threads. While this is usually OK because[0m
[30;1m164 | [0m[35m    # internally Python takes care of locking the shared resources, it also[0m
[30;1m165 | [0m[35m    # makes very difficult to build things on top of the logging system without[0m
[30;1m166 | [0m[35m    # using the same global approach.[0m
[30;1m167 | [0m[35m    # For simplicity, to make things easier to extension developers and because[0m
[30;1m168 | [0m[35m    # PyScaffold not really uses multiple threads, this is the case in[0m

[31m--[ [0m[34mMatch #[0m[33m748[0m[34m of [0m[33m759[0m[31m ]--[0m
   Rule Id: [34mBD000610[0m
